title: 104_s1620
content: The Act titled "Environmental Dredge Disposal Act of 1996" establishes regulations for dredged material disposal facilities. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities as a general navigation feature for Federal navigation projects, with limitations on the federal share of project costs. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities as a general navigation feature for Federal navigation projects, with limitations on the federal share of project costs related to operation and maintenance. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amends Section 101 to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities as a general navigation feature for Federal navigation projects, with limitations on the federal share of project costs related to operation and maintenance. The Federal share of operation and maintenance costs for a project shall not exceed $25,000,000 for any fiscal year, including costs for constructing dredged material disposal facilities. The Federal government covers costs for operating and maintaining navigation projects, dredged material disposal facilities, environmental dredging, and contaminated sediment mitigation. The Federal government covers costs for dredging, management, and disposal of contaminated sediments in critical port areas to facilitate maritime commerce and navigation. Preference is given to port areas where harbor maintenance fees exceed Federal expenditures. This subsection applies to dredged material disposal facilities. This subsection applies to the provision of a dredged material disposal facility where construction contracts have not been awarded before the enactment date. Cooperative agreements between the Secretary and non-Federal interests will be amended unless requested otherwise within 30 days. The agreement between the Secretary and non-Federal interests will be amended to conform to the new provisions regarding project costs for dredged material disposal facilities. The amendment will only apply to future agreements and will not increase the non-Federal share of costs for any dredged material disposal facility.
